context.p: A document is generated from an associated schema. They are generally used as inputs into deployments such as the sed, the netsim information etc. These documents make use of the autopopulation feature to populate all of the keys that it obtains from the associated schema.
Create a new document for the Deployment Inventory Tool

prereq.p: To create a new document the user must have the following:

ul.li: Associated Schema already created in the tool

info.p: Click the document view from the nav bar at the top
Select document type from dropdown (SED, Managed Config or Other)
Click the Create new document button
Enter the details as shown below.
NOTE: Restrictions on the fields are as follows:

ul.li: Name must be between 5 and 80 characters
Show Snapshots option may be turned on if you want snapshot versions of schemas to be visible in the next step
Schema must be an existing schema
Based on schema chosen you will need to fill out the document as needed.
Auto Populate option for SEDs may be turned on and off. When fields are autopopulated they are removed from the UI, \n more info can be found here.
If you have an existing document you wish to paste in the Paste Mode can be toggled.
Managed Configs can be attached using the + symbol.

info.p: Click the Save button and you will be redirected back to the previous page
NOTE: Document will not save if any fields are invalid (RED in UI)

result.p: A New Document is created in the Deployment Inventory Tool.
